title: Dear fanboys, imagine if I was the one having 15+ ban account  instead of Tyler1
body:
......and I got banned from playing LoL ever.

Would you fight for me?

------

Of course you wouldn't. You only look on those who makes you laugh by doing dumb shits in their videos & streams, or that you only look at those Plats & above who thinks they still deserve a 2nd chance (_or make that 3 chances including chat restrictions & 14 days suspension_).

This is typically why **I do not support any of these streamers who thinks they deserved to be unbanned**. Everyone is still given the same punishment treatment, no matter famous or not. I wasn't even pissed about Dunkey who stopped making his League videos, that's his decision. He was just butthurt that he received justice about what he said.

Tbh, I'm still currently a fan of Sky Williams (_who's a friend of Dunkey_) and I still watch his videos. But of course if there's one day he has suddenly got a suspension/permaban & will not post any League videos ever, I have no rights to complain about it. He deserved the punishment like any other ordinary players would have.  I'm also a fan of C9 and I liked watching almost every of their LCS matches, and I never complained about the time where Hai was pointing the middle finger at Ferbiven for making a bad remark on C9. He deserved the punishment too for doing that one unsportsmanlike action.

-------

So seriously, dear Tyler1 fanboys. Tone down your blonde girl attitude & admit the deserved punishment Tyler1 has. 15+ chances of reforming, and that says enough.

replies.body: yah it's right but i kinda feel bad for dunky tho. i guess some people are more sensitive than others.

He doesn't need sympathy. It was a week long ban, and he threw a tantrum because Riot didn't give him special treatment.
If you're still in the mindset that Dunky was banned because people are 'too sensitive,' I suggest you give [this ](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3kqrhp/people_arent_sensitive_for_reporting_flamers/) a read and think about it.

> [{quoted}](name=Wolfenstin,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=kldFcGo0,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-04-30T05:20:17.337+0000)
>
> He doesn't need sympathy. It was a week long ban, and he threw a tantrum because Riot didn't give him special treatment.
> If you're still in the mindset that Dunky was banned because people are 'too sensitive,' I suggest you give [this ](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3kqrhp/people_arent_sensitive_for_reporting_flamers/) a read and think about it.

People only care about what dunky said because he's in the public eye, but the hundreds of players who say worse and go a miss is the funny part. The feeder in the video gets no hate towards him because he's a no body and that's the sad part. It's like what happened to gross gore. He said something that turned into a mob. It's like when someone kills because of song lyrics. The band can't control what their fans do, how could gross gore? I feel like more and more people don't know how to tell what's make believe and what's real. League is life and life is the game.

Dunky wasn't even banned for what he said to the Malphite. Though what he said was childish and unproductive, even to a feeder, it's not what resulted in the ban anyway.

Of course the 'nobodies' get less attention; they don't record themselves being nasty to people and throw it up on YouTube for all to see and then claim they're in the right when a ban comes around on them. The reason Dunky gets as much attention as he does is because he fully embraced his toxic behavior. He claimed that raging was the only fun left to be had in League.

If that's what he was finding fun in this game, then good riddance. The ban might as well have been permanent.
Even worse are the lesser toxic people who get punished and then white knighted against.
i'm saying dunky is ttoo sensitive...

Well forgive me then, the wording made it seem otherwise.
I apologize for yelling at ya.

It actually gets me very upset that people think he left mainly cause of the ban. He stated he wasnt having much with the game, and wanted to move on. The ban was the last straw that set him off. He didnt quit cause he got banned for 2 weeks, infact, he makes fun of getting banned.

It isnt super relavent but i feel i should point this out. Im not saying what he did was fine, just that he didnt quite because he got banned.
I'm 95% sure that Dunkey was honestly just bored and fed up with Riot's lack of appreciation for his work for them; the ban was just an excuse to quit.

replies.poster: x R e n g a R x
replies.body:
Thank you for this post. Glad there's some people in this community that have a brain.

People who can't follow rules and bitch about getting banned need to go play another game.

No one cares about them and RIOT has also said they don't care about them. 

You either reform or make new accounts and still get banned for toxicity {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
Let's get this to the front of the boards. Very well said
Don't need to get it on the front of the boards. The tyler thread is already on the front page of reddit with the exact opposite reaction.

Looks like you're mad that streamers are more successful than you.

Stay riding on the coattails of success bro

"Successful". 

You mean GG who was banned from Twitch for doing repeated offences is successful?

Tyler1 who gains fame by being toxic & trolling, and then got kicked out from League forever was considered successful?

Please, don't mix me with those apes :)
... The average American wage is minimum wage? Hmmmmm lol
Yeah, I laughed a bit when I saw that. Not even remotely true.
why hasnt kaceytron been banned for ruining games like tyler1?

Kaceytron doesn't seem to have a feeder cult like Tyler1 does. I first heard about this guy from someone intentionally feeding, claiming he wouldn't be caught because he's following Tyler1's example. Conversely, Kaceytron runs her stream as a satire (by her own admission). Most of the people who watch her hate her, they don't walk away trying to replicate it. 

At the end of the day, Kaceytron is one troll, whos stream gets people to hate trolls and whos presence streaming prevents flocks of others from trying to take her spot. Tyler1 is one steamer whos stream encourages toxic behavior and feeding, and who has managed to convince others it's acceptable. Permanently shutting down Kaceytron does more harm than good, while shutting down Tyler1 does a lot of good.
All I know from her is that she's a bad Bronze 5 player who thinks she deserves Challenjour. But I don't remember anything about her being toxic/intentional feeding/trolling. Any videos of it?

She mostly streams League of Legends (or any game) to draw attention of horny males as well as males who think that mocking her is a great past time. In other words she doesn't actually care about winning or playing the game much. So long as people keep donating money to her, just so that she will read out their messages meant to taunt her.

I've watched her stream only 2-3 times, but each time, she's done something to hurt her team. Mostly it's AFKing/standing still for half the game, then feeding late since she's heavily underleveled and underfarmed. 

Maybe she needs a ban, maybe not. This is just what I've seen from her.

> [{quoted}](name=sorens,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=kldFcGo0,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-04-30T04:50:26.485+0000)
>
> why hasnt kaceytron been banned for ruining games like tyler1?

because kaceytron be a titty streama riot loves dem (wink)

As far as I know, Tyler hasn't shown a single unsportsmanlike conduct in any LCS matches either.

So by your logic he's good to go.

> C9 Jensen is an LCS pro player. **Tyler1 is just some guy in the suburbs.**

I never stated that Tyler was in an LCS ever. No need to twist the English around just to embrace your Tyler1 fanboy-hood.

> [{quoted}](name=HorusEye,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=kldFcGo0,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2016-04-30T14:02:51.697+0000)
>
> I never stated that Tyler was in an LCS ever. No need to twist the English around just to embrace your Tyler1 fanboy-hood.

That was the point.

And I am barely aware of the guy, let alone having ever watched his stream.
Sorry, tell me where he said LCS is the only place you can get punished for being unsportsmanlike.
He still has a shot at getting unbanned though. C9 Jensen actually had a history of toxicity and DDosing people. Yet he gets to play on C9.

Two things why both aren't comparable:

1) C9 Jensen is an LCS pro player. Tyler1 is just some guy in the suburbs.

2) Afaik, C9 Jensen has not shown a single unsportsmanlike Conduct in any LCS matches I've seen. Tyler1....well..., he has 19 permabanned accounts for a reason. He's easily triggered. I doubt he would last long if he ever be given a 2nd chance in the future.

So you're basically saying that a pro player can still get unbanned for conducting DDos attacks on people...cause he's a pro player?

By the way Jensen had 2 (no where near 19 though) permanently banned acoounts as well as a ban from tournaments before his supposed 'Final' ban.

I was referring to when after Jensen has already reformed & started competing with his fellow C9 players. Til now, he has not conducted any Unsportsmanlike Conduct/Ddos actions during his time for more than a year.

And like you said, Jensen has 2 permabanned accounts, while Tyler1 has 19. As you can see, Jensen isn't like someone who can still keep his old unsportsmanlike/ddos habits in him, whilst Tyler1 had 19 chances to do so & still fails. 

Do you still honestly think Tyler1 can keep up the good sportsmanship as Jensen is now? All you need to do is steal Tyler's blue buff & he will indeed go straight to intentional feeding.

I do like Tyler 1's stream, but in the end I'm saying there are past examples of this sort of thing happening. Also, in my opinion, DDos is a much more significant offense than just intetional feeding. It's like the difference between shoplifting and car theft. If you shoplift many,many times, you will eventually go to prison. But when you steal one car, one time, it's a much larger, much more prominent offense, and you will DEFINITELY got to prison.

He still probably could have tried a bit harder to reform completely, but the unique aspect of his stream would be gone.

 I think the straw that broke the camels back was Tyler going from a rather small stream to a 5K stream in a few weeks, as well as pro players speaking out against him.

They obviously wouldn't fight for you cause you're a nobody. And Tyler is not permabanned, that's impossible. Riot did the most they could, which is essentially stopping him from streaming League. He's obviously on his next account already playing off-stream.

> [{quoted}](name=TacticFire,realm=EUNE,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=kldFcGo0,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2016-05-02T03:02:32.723+0000)
>
> They obviously wouldn't fight for you cause you're a nobody. And Tyler is not permabanned, that's impossible. Riot did the most they could, which is essentially stopping him from streaming League. He's obviously on his next account already playing off-stream.

Which will get permabanned eventually. It's either his account is permabanned from tracking his IP address, or comparing his new account gameplay with his other 19 permabanned account gameplay. This is not a new case about this "He can't play LoL forever despite trying to have smurfs" scenario, as this happened to C9 Jensen before.
No, because you don't have any publicity.

No one said having publicity would give you special treatment, so therefore, players can still get banned despite having that.

Can't believe so many people are still surprised by it even after the Dunkey fiesta.
Wait, what? Being a public figure makes you invincible?

ye sure if he was a nobody riot wouldn't of banned him on identification they would just ban every account they had, that he continued to be toxic on , but because he is famous and on twitch they want to kick him off the platform so they said on identification. I've heard of people on youtube who said they were banned on 7 permanent accounts but you dont see riot saying they will ban them on identification.

Not trying to be rude, yes, you're right. No one would fight for you. But look at it this way. Would YOU get banned from playing LOL forever? Would Riot Socrates make a post about YOU on the boards? Imo Riot banned him, because of his popularity. You could say, he was "on the radar." I doubt Riot would give you a lifetime ban. I don't have any experience with this tho as I've never got banned ^_^ . I know a lot of other smaller streamers who are way more toxic and don't even get a lifetime ban.

Well I mean (in the case of smaller players) it's hard for Riot to detect every single case of int. feeding or trolling since most of the time they can just be playing bad (see: a lot of Bronze 5 cases) or having a bad streak (lord knows I've been on a couple of those).

I donated to Tyler because people on Reddit were harassing me and calling me a terrible human for doing it so I decided to fuck with them a bit and make them angrier sure I threw away money but oh well
Congrats, you became the the "people on Reddit" and the Circle of Life continues on. {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

Thats a stupid post.

You have done nothing for me ofc i wouldnt care if you got banned.
While Tyler1 gave me entertainment everyday.
This one had his grundle {{champion:48}}d

That's the point roflmao
this guy
